function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Influenza virus stability is compromised at higher temperatures","Impact":"Increased risk of influenza transmission in environments with higher temperatures","Mitigation":"Maintain lower temperatures in built environments to reduce the stability of the influenza virus","Technologies":"Temperature control systems, air conditioning, ventilation","People":"Occupants of built environments with higher temperatures","Owner":"Building managers, HVAC technicians"},{"Description":"Correlated independent variables in linear regression models can lead to inflated variances of estimated coefficients and inaccurate predictions","Impact":"Inaccurate predictions of virus viability and potential misleading conclusions","Mitigation":"Utilize techniques such as ridge regression, principal components regression, or LASSO to account for collinear regressors","Technologies":"Statistical modeling and regression analysis tools","People":"Data analysts, statisticians, researchers","Owner":"Statistical modeling experts, data analysis teams"},{"Description":"Nonlinear relationship between virus viability and absolute humidity (AH)","Impact":"Challenges in accurately modeling the impact of AH on virus viability","Mitigation":"Develop nonlinear regression models or alternative statistical approaches to capture the relationship between AH and virus viability","Technologies":"Nonlinear regression modeling, statistical software","People":"Researchers, data analysts","Owner":"Statistical modeling experts, research teams"}]}
